required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of Soft Tissue Vibration in Reducing Pain of Local Anesthesia Injection in Adult Dental Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Automated Soft Tissue Vibration in Reducing Pain and Accelerating Action of Intraoral Local Anesthesia Injections in Adult Dental Patients. A Randomized Crossover Clinical Trial.

lead_sponsor.agency: Riyadh Colleges of Dentistry and Pharmacy

clinical_study.source: Riyadh Colleges of Dentistry and Pharmacy

brief_summary.textblock: The clinical trial will compare pain perception during dental local anesthesia injections with and without using soft tissue vibration device prior to injection. The primary goal is to test the effectiveness of such devices in pain/discomfort reduction during intraoral local anesthesia injections in various techniques (infiltration and block anesthesia).

primary_outcome.measure: Pain of needle penetration of buccal LA injection
primary_outcome.description: The pain of needle penetration will be assessed using 10-point Graphic Rating Scale (GRS). The pain score will be compared to its counterpart pain score on the experimental side using DentalVibe® injection system.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain of anesthesia delivery during buccal LA infiltration
primary_outcome.description: The pain during anesthesia solution delivery will be assessed using 10-point Graphic Rating Scale (GRS). The pain score will be compared to its counterpart pain score on the experimental side using DentalVibe® injection system.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain of needle penetration of palatal LA injection
primary_outcome.description: The pain of needle penetration will be assessed using 10-point Graphic Rating Scale (GRS). The pain score will be compared to its counterpart pain score on the experimental side using DentalVibe® injection system.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain of anesthesia delivery during palatal LA infiltration
primary_outcome.description: The pain during anesthesia solution delivery will be assessed using 10-point Graphic Rating Scale (GRS). The pain score will be compared to its counterpart pain score on the experimental side using DentalVibe® injection system.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain of needle penetration of IAN block LA injection
primary_outcome.description: The pain of needle penetration will be assessed using 10-point Graphic Rating Scale (GRS). The pain score will be compared to its counterpart pain score on the experimental side using DentalVibe® injection system.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain of anesthesia delivery during IAN block LA injection
primary_outcome.description: The pain during anesthesia solution delivery will be assessed using 10-point Graphic Rating Scale (GRS). The pain score will be compared to its counterpart pain score on the experimental side using DentalVibe® injection system.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pain of buccal injection with DentalVibe®
arm_group.description: DentalVibe® Comfort Injection System will be used prior and during the local anesthesia (LA) buccal injection. The LA to be used is Lidocaine 2% with Epinephrine dental injection.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pain of buccal injection without DentalVibe®
arm_group.description: Local anesthesia (LA) for buccal infiltration using Lidocaine Epinephrine dental injection. No tissue vibrations will be performed before or during the injection.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pain of palatal injection with DentalVibe®
arm_group.description: DentalVibe® Comfort Injection System will be used prior and during the local anesthesia (LA) palatal injection. The LA to be used is Lidocaine 2% with Epinephrine dental injection.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pain of palatal injection without DentalVibe®
arm_group.description: Local anesthesia (LA) for palatal infiltration using Lidocaine Epinephrine dental injection. No tissue vibrations will be performed before or during the injection.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pain of block injection with DentalVibe®
arm_group.description: DentalVibe® Comfort Injection System will be used prior and during the local anesthesia (LA) injection for inferior alveolar nerve (IAN) block. The LA to be used is Lidocaine 2% with Epinephrine dental injection.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pain of block injection without DentalVibe®
arm_group.description: Local anesthesia (LA) injection for inferior alveolar nerve (IAN) block using Lidocaine Epinephrine dental injection. No tissue vibrations will be performed before or during the injection.

intervention.description: Soft tissue vibration for 10 seconds using DentalVibe®. The device induces approximately 16 soft tissue vibrations of per second. The device will be in touch of oral mucosa (at the site of injection) before and during the local anesthesia injection.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pain of block injection with DentalVibe®
Pain of buccal injection with DentalVibe®
Pain of palatal injection with DentalVibe®

intervention.description: Dental local anesthesia injection of 1.8 mL Lidocaine (2%) with Epinephrine (1:80000 w/v).
intervention.arm_group_label: Pain of block injection with DentalVibe®
Pain of block injection without DentalVibe®
Pain of buccal injection with DentalVibe®
Pain of buccal injection without DentalVibe®
Pain of palatal injection with DentalVibe®
Pain of palatal injection without DentalVibe®

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status class I
- Planned for multiple dental treatments in the maxilla and mandible bilaterally
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients <18 years old
- Pregnant ladies
- Smokers and alcoholics
- Patients on medications
- Drug abusers
- Never received dental treatment under local anesthesia before
- Patients with an acute infection with or without fever
- Patients with preoperative pain

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Riyadh Colleges of Dentistry and Pharmacy
